module.name: scimex
module.description: SeisComP3 event exchange between two systems.

parameter.name: mode
parameter.description: Mode of operation. Options are IMPORT or EXPORT.

parameter.name: subscriptions
parameter.description: Only used in export mode. A list of message groups to subscribe.

parameter.name: conversion
parameter.description: Used only in import mode. It defines the source format of the messages that need to be converted. Currently the import of SeisComP3 datamodel version 0.51 (imexscdm0.51) is supported which was used in release Barcelona (2008).

parameter.name: exportHosts
parameter.description: A list of names of recipients. These are used in hosts.$name directives (see below) to define addresses, filter criteria, etc. applicable to each recipient.

parameter.name: importHosts
parameter.description: List of names of suppliers from which to export. These are used with hosts.$name directives similarly to exportHosts.

struct.description: A definition of an event filter.

parameter.name: latitude
parameter.description: Pair of doubles that defines the latitude range, e.g. -90:90.

parameter.name: longitude
parameter.description: Pair of doubles that defines the longitude range, e.g. -180:180.

parameter.name: magnitude
parameter.description: Pair of doubles that defines the magnitude range, e.g. 3:10.

parameter.name: agencyID
parameter.description: White list of AgencyIDs (the agency identifier which appears in the objects sent over the export-import link).

struct.description: A sink definition used for either import or export.

parameter.name: address
parameter.description: Address of a sink, as a host name with an optional port number e.g. 'address = 192.168.1.1' or 'address = somewhere.com:4803'

parameter.name: criteria
parameter.description: Defining filter criteria name for sink, e.g. criteria = world-xxl. The criteria must be defined in the criteria.* configuration lines.

parameter.name: filter
parameter.description: Enables/disables filtering based on defined criteria. If set to false, all events will pass, even if one or more criteria are defined.

parameter.name: routingTable
parameter.description: Defining routing tables in the meaning of mapping objects to message groups. E.g. Pick:NULL, StationAmplitude:NULL, Origin:LOCATION, StationMagnitude: MAGNITUDE, NetworkMagnitude:MAGNITUDE, MagnitudeReference:MAGNITUDE, OriginReference:EVENT, Event:EVENT. Specifying NULL for the message group causes messages to be thrown away/dropped/discarded.

option.description: Print the default object routing table.
